convertTclDoubleEscaped

public static String convertTclDoubleEscaped(CharSequence _text)
Converts given string by escaping all special characters for TCL for escaped MQL commands. In some cases a quote must be converted to backslash backslash backslash quote '\\\"'.

Parameters:
_text - character stream to convert
Returns:
converted string

convertToFileName

public static String convertToFileName(String _name)

Decodes given MX name to a name which could be used within a file system. This must be done because some characters could not handled correctly from the file system.

Following characters are not converted:

  • number
  • alphabetic character (lower and upper case)
  • left or right parenthesis
  • plus '+' or minus '-'
  • comma ',' or point '.'
  • space
  • equals sign '='
  • underscore '_'

All other characters are converted with the algorithm:

  • the "at symbol" '@' will be converted to double at symbol '@@'
  • if a character is in the range of 0 and 254 (ASCII character), then the character is converted to a two characters long hexa-decimal code with '@' as prefix (e.g. double quotes '=' is converted to '@22')
  • characters greater than 254 are converted to a four characters long hexa-decimal code with '@u' as prefix (e.g. the euro sign '€' is converted to '@u20AC')

Parameters:
_name - MX name to convert
Returns:
converted file name
See Also:
convertFromFileName(String)

convertFromFileName

public static String convertFromFileName(String _fileName)
                                  throws UpdateException_mxJPO

Encodes the given file name back to internal used names. This must be done because some characters could not handled correctly from the file system.

The same characters described in convertToFileName(String) are converted back.

Parameters:
_fileName - name from file to convert
Returns:
converted name extracted from a file name
Throws:
UpdateException_mxJPO - if the configuration item name could not be extracted from the file name _fileName because the encoded special characters are not in correct format
See Also:
convertToFileName(String)

convertFromFileNameGetChar

private static char convertFromFileNameGetChar(char[] _charFileName,
                                               int _idx)
                                        throws UpdateException_mxJPO
Returns the character on the position _idx within character array _charFileName. If the position does not exists, an exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
_charFileName - character array
_idx - index in the character array _charFileName
Returns:
the character on index _idx in character array _charFile
Throws:
UpdateException_mxJPO - if the number in _idx is greater then the length of the character array _charFileName (meaning array out of bound exception)

joinTcl

public static String joinTcl(char _separator,
                             boolean _quotes,
                             Collection<String> _list,
                             String _emptyString)
A list of string is joined to one string. Between two string the given separator is set. If quotes parameter is defined each element of the list is surrounded with quotes. Each element is converted to TCL code.

Parameters:
_separator - separator between two list items
_quotes - surround the elements of the string with quotes
_list - list of strings
_emptyString - string which is written if the list is empty (or null if no string for empty list is written)
Returns:
joined string of the list items
See Also:
convertMql(CharSequence)

formatFileDate

public static String formatFileDate(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache,
                                    Date _date)
Formats given date with time (normally from the last modification time of a file) to the related string representation in MX. The convert is done in time zone TIMEZONE so that always the same time zone is used (e.g. summer and winter time...).

Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache
_date - last modification date of a file to convert to a string
Returns:
string representation of the date in time zone TIMEZONE
See Also:
PARAM_FILEDATEFORMAT

parseFileDate

public static Date parseFileDate(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache,
                                 String _date)
                          throws ParseException
Parses given string with date and time in time zone TIMEZONE and returns related date.

Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache
_date - string with the last modified date in time zone TIMEZONE
Returns:
parsed date instance
Throws:
ParseException - if date string could not be parsed
See Also:
PARAM_FILEDATEFORMAT

formatInstalledDate

public static String formatInstalledDate(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache,
                                         Date _date)
Formats given installation date to the related string representation in MX. The convert is done in time zone TIMEZONE so that always the same time zone is used (e.g. summer and winter time...).

Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache
_date - installed date to convert to a string
Returns:
string representation of the date in time zone TIMEZONE
See Also:
PARAM_INSTALLEDDATEFORMAT

joinMql

public static String joinMql(char _separator,
                             boolean _quotes,
                             Collection<String> _list,
                             String _emptyString)
A list of string is joined to one string. Between two string the given separator is set. If quotes parameter is defined each element of the list is surrounded with quotes. Each element is converted to MQL code.

Parameters:
_separator - separator between two list items
_quotes - surround the elements of the string with quotes
_list - list of strings
_emptyString - string which is written if the list is empty (or null if no string for empty list is written)
Returns:
joined string of the list items
See Also:
convertMql(CharSequence)

match

public static boolean match(String _filename,
                            String _wildcardMatcher)
The method is original implemented by the project on Apache Commons IO and copied from method wildcardMatch within class org.apache.commons.io.FilenameUtils.

Parameters:
_filename - file name to check
_wildcardMatcher - wildcard matcher string
Returns:
true if _filename matches _wildcardMatcher

splitOnTokens

public static String[] splitOnTokens(String _text)
The method is original implemented by the project on Apache Commons IO and copied from method splitOnTokens within class org.apache.commons.io.FilenameUtils. Splits a string into a number of tokens.

Parameters:
_text - the text to split
Returns:
the tokens, never null
